Here are a couple of powerful things you can do in Marp to make your slides look professional:

### 1. Split Slides (Image + Text)
You can easily split a slide so an image takes up one side (left or right) and your text takes up the other. This is great for minimizing bullet-point fatigue.

Use the `bg` keyword in the image syntax, followed by `left` or `right` and a percentage size.

**Syntax:**
```markdown
![bg right:40%](images/my-diagram.png)

# This is the Title
- This text appears on the left (60%).
- The image appears on the right (40%).
```

### 2. Slide-Specific Styling
Sometimes you want one slide to look different (e.g., a dark title slide or a "Quote" slide). You can apply classes or styles just to the *current* slide using an underscore `_`.

**Example: Invert colors for a dramatic transition**
```markdown
<!-- _class: invert -->

# This Slide is Dark
White text on a black background.
```

**Example: Remove page number for the title slide**
```markdown
<!-- _paginate: false -->

# Title Slide
No page number here.
```
